meanings.definition: A vertical pillar or post typically supporting a structure.
meanings.sent1: The ancient building had a strong column holding up the roof.
meanings.sent2: The architect included a column in the design to provide additional support.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel climbed the column thinking it was a tree.
meanings.sent4: His determination was like a sturdy column, unwavering in the face of challenges.
meanings.sent5: The towering column stood tall against the backdrop of the city skyline.

meanings.definition: A vertical division of text on a page or in a document.
meanings.sent1: The newspaper article had a column dedicated to sports news.
meanings.sent2: The textbook had a column of vocabulary words on the side.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous student scribbled in the wrong column of the worksheet.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts flowed down the page like a column of neatly arranged words.
meanings.sent5: The column of numbers added up to the total at the bottom of the page.

meanings.definition: A regular feature or section in a newspaper or magazine.
meanings.sent1: The advice column in the magazine offered tips on relationships.
meanings.sent2: The fashion column showcased the latest trends in clothing.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous editor accidentally deleted the entire column before printing.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a bright column of light in the room.
meanings.sent5: The column on healthy eating inspired readers to make positive changes.
